Did you know you can add lists together?

A quick way to get a string list is the Slit command (especially useful for menu options)
[code:1j6vr26m]l1 = Split("one|two|three", "|")
msg(l1)
-> List: one; two; three; [/code:1j6vr26m]
Now we have a list, we can add strings to it and other string lists:
[code:1j6vr26m]l2 = "zero" + l1 + "four"
msg(l2)
-> List: zero; one; two; three; four; 
l3 = l2 - "two"
msg(l3)
-> List: zero; one; three; four; 
l4 = l1 + l3
msg(l4)
-> List: one; two; three; zero; one; three; four; [/code:1j6vr26m]
Also works for object lists:
[code:1j6vr26m]ol = NewObjectList()
ol2 = ol + player
msg(ol2)[/code:1j6vr26m]
And mixed lists, here in one step I add an object and a string:
[code:1j6vr26m]l = NewList()
l2 = l + player + "player"[/code:1j6vr26m]
You cannot subtract one list from another, and it does not work for dictionaries.
